texto: 3.7 dispute <customer satisfaction> disagreement, arising from a complaint (3.3), submitted to a DRP-provider (3.9) Note 1 to entry: Some organizations (3.12) allow their customers (3.4) to express their dissatisfaction to a DRP- provider in the first instance. In this situation, the expression o f dissatis faction becomes a complaint when sent to the organization for a response, and becomes a dispute if not resolved by the organization without DRP-provider intervention. Many organizations pre fer their customers to first express any dissatis faction to the organization before utilizing dispute resolution external to the organization. [SOURCE: ISO 9000:2015, 3.9.6]
